4.5. SemiPy.Physics package¶

4.5.1. Submodules¶

4.5.2. SemiPy.Physics.DevicePhysics module¶

This will house some basic device physics equations

SemiPy.Physics.DevicePhysics.carrier_density(cox, vg, vt)[source]¶
SemiPy.Physics.DevicePhysics.characteristic_length(epichannel, epiox, tchannel, tox)[source]¶

Compute the characteristic length of a FET (lambda = sqrt(epi_channel * t_channel * tox / epi_ox)) :param epichannel: :param epiox: :param tchannel: :param tox:

Returns

lambda

SemiPy.Physics.DevicePhysics.compute_cox(dielectric_constant, tox)[source]¶

4.5.3. Modeling module¶

This module contains code for modeling 2D Schottky FETs. This is adapted from ‘’

class SemiPy.Physics.Modeling.TwoDFETs.Stanford2D.Stanford2DSModel(FET, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: SemiPy.Physics.Modeling.BaseModel.BaseModel

Compact model for modeling traps, parasitic capacitances, velocity saturation, self-heating, and field effects of 2D FETs. The reference paper is Saurabh V.Suryavanshi, Eric Pop. Journal of Applied Physics; 2016, which gives full physical details on the model.

transmission(E, phib, hole=False, electron=False)[source]¶

Returns:
